item.description:
Hi Laughing Matter,

Tonight is a speical night!

Dr. Patch Adams will speak about his belief that laughter, joy and creativity are essential parts of the healing process, and therefore imperative to effective health care.

We will meet in Blackman Auditorium, the main building of Northeastern University Campus, located in Ell hall, right behind the Northeastern sign on Huntington Ave, just down the block from the YMCA.

Meet you all in the lobby at 7:15 pm. We will talk about the show yesterday as well as play a few games upstairs beforehand.

The event is free!

See you there! 

Peace and prosperity!

Jason
item.how_to_find_us: We will meet in the lobby. This is in the main building, Ell hall, right behind the Northeastern sign on Huntington Ave, just down the block from the YMCA
item.why: Ever seen the movie “Patch Adams,” starring Robin Williams? Hunter Campbell “Patch” Adams, M.D., is a doctor, clown and social activist who has been solely devoted to improving the American health care system for more than 30 years.

group.name: Great Boston Chapter of Laughing Matter - Auditions Circle

item.name: A Night with Patch Adams
